text: Wendy Smits (22 January 1983 – 9 October 2022) was an international Dutch handball player.De omgekeerde weg van een handbaltalent, De Volkskrant, 4 January 2010 Smits moved in 2005 from HV SEW to the Germany and played with TuS Metzingen, HSG Sulzbach Leidersbach and Frisch Auf Göppingen. She moved back to the Netherlands and played with SV Dalfsen Handbal between 2009 and 2012. After playing for the last three months in 2012 with HSG Blomberg-Lippe she played from 2013 with Fortissimo. At the end of December 2015, she moved to Foreholte due to a conflict with her coach Kees Boomhouwer.OUD INTERNATIONAL WENDY SMITS OPGESTAPT NA CONFLICT MET KEES BOOMHOUWER, handbalinside.nl, 8 December 2015 Smits also played 14 mathces for the Netherlands women's national handball team. She was assistant coach of the under-16 national women's team.Slechts 39 jaar: Wendy Smits overleden, handbalstartpunt.nl, 10 October 2022 Smits was married and had a daughter. They lived in Almere. Due to a serious illness, Smits died in October 2022 at the age of 39 years old. ==References== Category:1983 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Handball players Category:Sportspeople from Amsterdam Category:Sportswomen
title: Wendy Smits
